attributes.action: AQA Biology Exam May 17, Irrelevant questions to be removed from marking
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/2016/05/17/students-left-fuming-over-gcse-biology-exam-that-contained-quest/
https://uk.news.yahoo.com/gsce-pupils-could-not-believe-203400504.html?nhp=1
- Two sources of online news reports on the reaction of 100,000 students
attributes.background: The questions on alcohol and under age drinking along with independent companies has no relevance to biology. It makes an unfair playing field as students taking the same exam with other boards will have the ability to attain better grades/ marks.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept your petition because the UK Government or Parliament is not responsible for the issue you raise. Exam boards are responsible for the questions they set. Exam boards are regulated by the Office of Qualifications and Examinations Regulation (Ofqual), which regulates qualifications, examinations and assessments in England.

You can make a complaint to Ofqual about the organisations it regulates. Further information about how to complain is available here: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/ofqual/about/complaints-procedure.
